results.title: Profit, you gotta be out of your cotton pickin' mind
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Making a profit, the essence of business survival, is humorously traced in retelling the story of Eli Whitney and his cotton gin. This animated story illustrates a simple explanation of the need for profit in business.

results.title: Profit by design
results.creator_credit: John Ingram, Humphrey Swingler and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: Indicates how design in manufacture is at the heart of the whole process and affects all sections of a factory, even sales and profits.

results.title: Profile: Canada
results.creator_credit: Jim Turpie, Crawley Films and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film offers a magnificent panorama of Canada from coast to coast. The land, the people, the industries, the pleasures - in fact the entire life of the nation is beautifully filmed in this colorful composite survey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Turpie, Crawley Films and ONF | NFB

results.title: Profile of a quartet
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, Peter Newington and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A glimpse of the work which goes into a production of good chamber music. Introduces the members of the Quartet both at home with their families and at rehearsal together where much discussion takes place and several pieces of chamber music are played. Illustrates the focussing of the four men’s lives to produce this close teamwork.

results.title: Produktionsfrasmaschine PFV 140
results.brief_description: Setting up a large automatic machine tool device. Follows the loading of the program, and various switch settings. The material to be processed is placed in position of the processing platform and the operation commences.

results.title: Products of Broken Hill
results.brief_description: Describes the mineral products of Broken Hill, the methods of processing the ore, and the refining of lead at Port Pirie and zinc at Risdon, Tasmania.

results.title: Productivity, key to plenty
results.brief_description: Produced in co-operation with the Twentieth Century Fund, based on a study by the Fund entitled “America’s needs and resources”, by Dr J Frederic Dewhurst and collaborators. This film aims to analyse America’s production and consumption.

results.title: Productivity primer
results.creator_credit: Bob Godfrey and Biographic Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A consideration of two issues - what is productivity and why does it matter. To employ more married women, postpone retirement, bring in immigrant workers are some suggested ways of increasing Britain’s output.

results.title: Productivity is people
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A case-study in management - employee relations based on the concept of a productivity improvement team. In the course of the film the team members express their personal views on advantages of the concept.

results.title: Production of foods
results.brief_description: in studying the technology and geography of food production, the following points are given attention: the relation of animal food production to plant food production; methods used to produce plant foods and animal foods; and the important function of the soil in all food production.
